jni

Class JniLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • jni.JniLayer

  • public class JniLayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the connection between the Java user-interface code and the C++ VRPN code
    Author:
    Eric Boren

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JniLayer(int[] analogs, int numButtons, int port)
      Instantiates a new JniLayer, for communication between this Android app and the VRPN network.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getPort()
      Returns the port number which is being used.
      boolean isRunning()
      Is the Android server on the C++ side instantiated?
      void mainLoop()
      Calls the mainloop() method on the VRPN Android Server.
      void reportAnalogChg(int analogId)
      Forces a data report to be sent from the given analog server, even if the value has not changed.
      void start()
      Instantiates VRPN servers on the C++ side and opens a connection.
      void stop()
      Deconstructs all objects on the C++ side and closes the connection.
      void updateAnalogVal(int analogId, int channel, float val)
      Sets the value for the specified channel in the specified analog server.
      void updateButtonStatus(int buttonId, boolean state)
      Sets the status (up or down) of a given button.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • JniLayer

        public JniLayer(int[] analogs,
        int numButtons,
        int port)
        Instantiates a new JniLayer, for communication between this Android app and the VRPN network. Should only be called from JniBuilder.
        Parameters:
        analogs - - an array representing the number of channels in each analog server
        numButtons - - the number of buttons used by the app
        port - - the port number to use for connections

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Instantiates VRPN servers on the C++ side and opens a connection.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Deconstructs all objects on the C++ side and closes the connection. This is necessary any time the app loses focus.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Is the Android server on the C++ side instantiated?
        Returns:
        - whether or not the VRPN Android Server is up and running

      • mainLoop

        public void mainLoop()
        Calls the mainloop() method on the VRPN Android Server. This initiates the sending of data to the client, and should be called at least once every three seconds in order to prevent the client from complaining, even if no data has changed.

      • updateButtonStatus

        public void updateButtonStatus(int buttonId,
                      boolean state)
        Sets the status (up or down) of a given button. True for button down, false for button up.
        Parameters:
        buttonId - - the button whose status to update
        state - - whether to set the button's status to pressed (true) or not pressed (false)

      • updateAnalogVal

        public void updateAnalogVal(int analogId,
                   int channel,
                   float val)
        Sets the value for the specified channel in the specified analog server.
        Parameters:
        analogId - - The identifier of the analog server to update
        channel - - Which channel (or dimension) of the analog to pass the value
        val - - The new value

      • reportAnalogChg

        public void reportAnalogChg(int analogId)
        Forces a data report to be sent from the given analog server, even if the value has not changed.
        Parameters:
        analogId - - The identifier of the analog server for which to report a value

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port number which is being used.
        Returns:
        port - the port which is in use
